DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study develop external Trigeminal Nerve Stimulation ( eTNS ) potential nonmedication treatment attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder ( ADHD ) . Study hypothesis address potential difference 4 week active vs. sham eTNS treatment ADHD symptom , measure executive function , electroencephalography ( EEG ) profile , dimensional measure height , weight , mood , anxiety , sleep , side effect profile .

The study enroll 85-90 participant age 8-12 year achieve completion target N=36 study condition ( total final N = 72 ) . Participants meet Diagnostic Statistical Manual-5 ( DSM-5 ) criterion ADHD , current presentation , establish Behavior Disorders Module Kiddie Schedule Affective Disorders Schizophrenia ( KSADS-PL ) clinical interview . Other screen procedure include measure ADHD symptom severity , behavioral rating , cognitive assessment . Once inclusion/exclusion criterion review verify , participant pre-treatment visit establish behavioral cognitive baseline rating obtain EEG . Participants parent instruct use eTNS , participant begin use eTNS direct sleep night . Participants randomize 1:1 active inactive sham eTNS . Participants , family , study team remain blind treatment assignment . Participants weekly assessment eight week study assess behavioral , cognitive , brain activation change monitor safety , tolerability , compliance . Weekly rating obtain parent , teacher , clinician investigator . EEG occur baseline , end treatment ( week 4 ) .
